Detailed Description

This class is a singleton main loop task for managing and ticking the VoIP client.

This task must be initialised before any script code that could call BigWorld.VOIP.* is executed.

See also:
VOIPClient

PyVOIP

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

VOIPApp::VOIPApp (  ) 

Constructor for VOIPApp.

The VOIPApp adds its self to the pool of main loop tasks under 'VOIP/App'.

VOIPApp::~VOIPApp (  ) 

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

void VOIPApp::draw (  )  [virtual]

This method currently does nothing.

Reimplemented from MainLoopTask.

void VOIPApp::fini (  )  [virtual]

This method cleans up the VOIPApp by destroying the previously created voip client.

Note:
The python module BigWorld.VOIP must not be used after this point.

Reimplemented from MainLoopTask.

VOIPClient & VOIPApp::getVOIPClient (  )  [static]

This function retrieves the VOIPClient possessed by the VOIPApp.

Returns:
The VOIPClient owned by the VOIPApp instance
Note:
This function must not be called before the VOIPApp has been initialised.

bool VOIPApp::init (  )  [virtual]

This method initalises the VOIPApp by creating the VOIPClient from the voip.dll.

Note:
The VOIPClient is not initialised in this method but instead intended to be initialised through python.

Reimplemented from MainLoopTask.

void VOIPApp::tick ( float  dTime  )  [virtual]

This method ticks the VOIPClient each frame.

Passing in the current position and rotation of the player.

Reimplemented from MainLoopTask.
